oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Yearbook “Salmagundi,” of the Boscobel College for Young Ladies, Nashville, Tennessee, 1907
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1907 yearbook, known as “Salmagundi,” published by the Boscobel College for Young Ladies, featuring students, faculty, trustees, clubs, athletics, societies, and more. The Board of Trustees membership included Jno D. Anderson, Morton B. Howell, T.F. Bonner, H.W. Buttorff, Dr. A.C. Cree, F.M. Dorris, Jno. W. Love, W.V. Davidson, Byrd Murray, Dr. J.P. Gray, W.W. Napier, M.F. Green, J.M. Warren, and Col. W.M. Woodcock. The officers of the Board of Trustees: Dr. A.C. Cree, President; Dr. J.P. Gray, Vice-President; T.F. Bonner, Secretary and Treasurer. Executive Committee: Jno. D. Anderson, W.V. Davidson, W.W. Napier. Finance Committee: H. W. Buttorff, Jno. D. Anderson, and Jno. W. Love. The Boscobel College for Young Ladies was a college in East Nashville, founded in 1889 as the Nashville Baptist Female College by the Tennessee Baptist Convention. The college operated for twenty-five years--until 1914. The campus was built around an East Nashville mansion, formerly owned by Anna Shelby Williams. The mansion stood atop a tree-covered hill overlooking the Cumberland River. The campus covered ten wooded acres on Sevier Street near South Seventh Street (then called Foster Street), south of Sylvan Street. In 1918, the property became home to the National Baptist Seminary and Missionary Training School, which functioned until 1931. The buildings were razed in 1940. The advertisers in the yearbook include the Wright Bros.; Gordon-Martin-Cline Co.; M. Cook & Co. Druggists; D.A. Dortch; Hunter & Company; H.G. Hill & Co.; Southern Automobile Co.; Crone & Jackson; The B.H. Stief Jewelry Co.; G.C. Dury & Co.; Calvert Brothers; Cline & Gordon; A. Bergeda & Bro.; Joy & Son; Tulane Hotel; DeMoville Drug Company; Castner-Knott Dry Goods Company; Nashville Railway and Light Company; Maxwell House Shoe Store; H.A. French Music Publisher; Geo. P. Staley Co.; The Cumberland Telephone; Neuhoff’s Cash Markets; Meadors & Son; Jones & Hopkins Mfg. Company; Taylor Photographer; Jensen, Herzer & Jeck Jewelers; Armston-Pendleton Company; Venable’s Fine Candy; Jerome B. Sand Druggist; M.E. Derryberry & Company; Waldorf Stable; D. Loveman & Co.; The Morton-Scott-Robertson Co.; Max Bloomstein’s Pharmacy; Welch Stave and Heading Co. (Monterey, Tennessee); Bernstein Brothers; Phillips & Buttorf Manufacturing Co.; Montgomery & Co.; Brandon Printing Co.; D. Lowenheim & Co.; Geo. R. Calhoun & Company; Lebeck Bros.; Smith, Crittenden & Co.; Empire Coal Company; and Brandon Printing Company. Forms part of the yearbook collection: Boscobel College, “Salmagundi,” 1907. 1 volume
